Message.Title: Labor participation rate is LOWEST it has been in 30 years.
Message.Msg: "The UE rate as bad as it is, doesn't even tell the whole truth." Believe it or not, it creates the perfect environment for the eventual innovation which will lift us out of it. The idle minds of the workers will busy themselves with pipe dreams, and some of the dreams will become manifest in the economy. I am an inventor. Necessity is the mother of invention. With a high percentage of unemployed people working on gaining a leg up, the probability of innovation grows. OTOH, giving out food stamps, stifles the necessity and urgency. It may not actually happen until after more wealth is distributed in social programs and the democrats run out of options. It is called a Kondratiev economic winter and it waits for innovation to become the spring.

Topic.Title: Labor participation rate is LOWEST it has been in 30 years.

Message.Msg: During the recovery that ended in October 2012, the vast majority of the jobs were created for our oldest demographic (age 55-69), while our most productive demographic (ages 24-55) realized no net new job gains. Nearly 60% of new jobs are paying hourly wages between $7-14. A nation of hamburger flippers. Another 1.9 million Americans joined the ranks of food stamp recipients last year, exceeding the total number of jobs created!!! OBAMA TAKES A VICTORY LAP. Knowing this reality, it is baffling to see the market's gullible response to data reported by government agencies that is continually massaged to illicit positive sentiment. Optimism must be grounded in realism. The number of Americans seeking unemployment benefits fell last week to the lowest level in five years according to the Department of Labor, which pundits cited as evidence that employers were cutting fewer jobs-or did it? Initial claims for unemployment insurance declined on a seasonally-adjusted basis to 330k. In reality, the actual number of people filing initial claims was more than 436k. Seasonal adjustments were used to make the number look better. The North Korean lib media is doing high fives.

Topic.Title: Gun control?

Message.Msg: President Obama's comments caused a stir, as people asked why he had never mentioned it before and why they had never seen photos. So it's true. The White House is responding to critics who questioned whether President Obama has ever been skeet shooting. White House Senior adviser Dan Pfeiffer tweeted out the picture on Saturday morning after much skepticism about the president's claim that he participates in the sport "all the time." "POTUS shoots clay targets on the range at Camp David on Aug. 4, 2012," reads the tweet, with a link to the photograph. The photo would appear to quiet the controversy that arose after an interview with The New Republic, in which Obama talked about frequent skeet shooting. The publication asked: "Have you ever fired a gun?" Obama responded: "Yes, in fact, up at Camp David, we do skeet shooting all the time."
